summary: This is a letter from U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman to attorney Roberta A. Kaplan, responding to a request for documents related to Jeffrey Epstein and plaintiff Jane Doe in the civil case Doe v. Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein. The letter encloses various documents including grand jury subpoena service reports, a biographical report on Jane Doe, FBI contact reports, and documents retrieved from Epstein's residences.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the letter responding to a document request related to Jeffrey Epstein and Jane Doe, providing enclosed documents.

persons.name: Roberta A. Kaplan
persons.role: Attorney at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP
persons.context: Recipient of the letter; she requested documents from the DOJ related to Jeffrey Epstein and plaintiff Jane Doe in the civil case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the document request and related investigations; documents include items from his New York and Palm Beach residences.

persons.name: Jane Doe
persons.context: Plaintiff in Doe v. Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein; subject of grand jury subpoena service reports, a biographical report, and FBI contact reports.

connections.description: Kaplan is representing Jane Doe in the civil case Doe v. Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein, as evidenced by her document request on behalf of the plaintiff.
Jane Doe is a plaintiff in a civil case against Epstein's estate, indicating an alleged victim-perpetrator relationship central to the litigation.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is formally responding to Kaplan's document request in a professional legal capacity.

events.title: Document Request Letter
events.description: Roberta A. Kaplan sent a letter to the DOJ requesting documents related to Jeffrey Epstein and Jane Doe.

events.title: DOJ Document Production
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman responds to Kaplan's request, providing electronic versions of various documents including grand jury subpoena service reports, a biographical report on Jane Doe, FBI contact reports, and documents from Epstein's residences.

events.title: Document Retrieval from Trash
events.description: Pages from a document were obtained from discarded trash outside Jeffrey Epstein's Palm Beach residence.

events.title: Electronic Device Search
events.description: A document was retrieved from an electronic search of a device in Epstein's New York residence.

locations: 86 Chambers Street, New York, New York 10007
Palm Beach residence (occupied by Jeffrey Epstein)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced documents including grand jury subpoena service reports on Jane Doe, a redacted biographical report on her, FBI contact reports with her, and documents from searches of Epstein's residences.
Documents were obtained from discarded trash outside Epstein's Palm Beach residence in approximately April 2005, indicating early investigative activity.
A document was retrieved from an electronic device search at Epstein's New York residence in 2019, showing post-arrest investigative efforts.
The document production is governed by Touhy regulations, which control how federal agencies respond to subpoenas and document requests in litigation.
The correspondence is part of the civil case Doe v. Estate of Jeffrey E. Epstein, indicating ongoing litigation against Epstein's estate by an alleged victim.
